    • Method Detail

      • instance

        public static MailFetcher instance()
        Returns the singleton instance of the MailFetcher.
        Returns:
        the instance of the MailFetcher or null if the initialization of the fetcher failed (due to configuration problems).

      • deleteMessage

        public boolean deleteMessage(javax.mail.Message message)
        Deletes an email message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Returns:
        true if the email message was deleted successfully (which means the deleted flag was set), false otherwise

      • expungeMessages

        public boolean expungeMessages()
        Expunge (permanently remove) messages having the deleted flag.
        Returns:
        true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise

      • getUniqueMessageId

        public String getUniqueMessageId(javax.mail.Message message)
        Returns a unique id for an email message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message
        Returns:
        the unique id or null if not found

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Stops the mail-fetcher.

      • startFetching

        public void startFetching(MailMessageWorker worker)
                   throws MailboxConnectionException
        Blocking method which starts fetching mails. All mails found which do not have the deleted flag will be passed to the mail message worker. The method only returns in case of an error (e.g. connection to the mail server was lost) or when another thread called the shutdown() method.
        Parameters:
        worker - used for processing mails
        Throws:
        MailboxConnectionException - if an error or exception occurs while connecting or listening. The exception holds information whether a restart at a later time may succeed.
